choices.D: Replace the RAID controller write cache module.
choices.B: Check the event log for any cache issues.
choices.C: Clear the RAID configuration file and restart the PC.

discussion.content: Event Log is your best friend. It's an easy tool for seeing tons of issues. Make sure to keep good records of events in your setup as well. You may troubleshoot something only to find yourself tackling a similar issue months later. Document, troubleshoot, and keep GREAT records. It'll go a long way in helping you on the job.

RAID arrays use a battery backed cache, so they can process data faster than they can write it. Without the battery, they couldn't do caching without risk of data loss during a power failure. If your raid controllers battery (BBU) is dead, then write caching will be disabled. 
On a dell server running windows server 2012r2 with a PERC raid controller, an error pops up telling me that the battery has failed and that write caching has been disabled. I truly hope that this appears in the event log as well, but it is hard to say. That raid controller in my Dell server can be accessed using the "Openmanage Server Administrator" tool, which is a web server running at localhost:1311 (https) - but on another server of mine that has (I think) an LSI Megaraid controller, it doesnt let me manage it from within windows at all. I have to manage it all during a bootup of the server. - needless to say, I don't beleive that one shows me any errors in the windows event log. I have to observe the blinking lights, or hang around the office late at night to do a scheduled reboot to check on it.

Regardless, the first thing you do is check the log. Then you probably need to replace that damned battery....
It's an easy tool for seeing tons of issues

Selected Answer: B
B, Agreed. The other answers dont make sense; I mean, you can't fix a problem if you don't know what the problem is, Right? You can guess but before taking steps you should know for sure

questions.question_text:
A technician is troubleshooting a Windows CAD workstation that is running slow. The computer uses RAID 10 and has dual GPU cards. The user states that the same application runs faster on an identical workstation.
Which of the following should the technician perform FIRST to troubleshoot the problem?

choices.D: Document the findings in the organization's local knowledge base.
choices.B: Implement preventive measures by manually assigning a DNS server to the PC.
choices.C: Identify the problem by running the command ipconfig /flushdns.
choices.A: Test the theory by attempting to browse to a website's known IP address.

discussion.content: How is this not C? The tech has guessed the reason for it now he has to test it by running ipconfig and then implement a solution which would be flush dns.

comments.content: "A" would help you test and identify the problem best.

The wording of choice C is why. ipconfig / flushdns wouldn't IDENTIFY the problem, it would SOLVE the problem. In addition, the technician still needs to test his or her theory in order to be sure the issue is in fact related to DNS. The correct answer is A.

Six step for troubleshooting process should be followed here.
1. Identify the problem. 
2. Establish a theory of probable cause. 
3.Test the theory to determine the cause.
4.Establish a plan of action to resolve the problem and implement the solution. 
5.Verify full system functionality and if applicable, implement preventive measures. 
6. Document findings, actions, and outcomes.
 from the question "A technician believes the cause of the issue is related to DNS" so after that he should establish the theory of probable cuause..that why A is the Answer.

questions.question_text:
A user reports being unable to browse the Internet. A technician believes the cause of the issue is related to DNS.
Which of the following should the technician perform NEXT?

choices.A: The computer is utilizing one channel.
choices.D: The computer is utilizing four channels.
choices.B: The computer is utilizing two channels.
choices.C: The computer is utilizing three channels.

comments.content:
But isn't that, when I use dual channel, I need to put same 8GB on slot 1and 3, 4GB on slot 2and 4?
Science he put 8GB on slot 1and2, which means that there will be 1channel each for all 4 slots?

discussion.content: to use the four channel Feature, you need four Modules, which have the same number of GB. So here you can only use the two channel feature
It is even advisable to put the Rams into the slots in that pattern, and Isn't it best practice to use the same model, speed, and throughput of memory?

questions.question_text:

4GB sticks of 3200-speed DDR4 and installs then in slots 3 and 4. While installing the RAM into the board, the user notices the board has `quad channel` etched near the RAM slots.
Which of the following can be said about the user's channel configuration after upgrading the RAM?

A technician is building a CAD workstation for a user who will be saving files remotely.
Which of the following components are MOST important to include when configuring the system? (Choose two.)

comments.content: "C" is really just for the cloud provider to charge the client for the services used.

discussion.content: Me just reading this once and not thinking about this question, or the answers much I feel like it's "C," because it says based on real-time traffic on the website, but this may be incorrect.

The correct answer is B.
Rapid elasticity is a cloud computing term for scalable provisioning, or the ability to provide scalable services.

https://www.google.com/search?q=cloud+computing%3A+Rapid+elasticity&oq=cloud+computing%3A+Rapid+elasticity&aqs=chrome..69i57.12243j0j1&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8
If here we had option "On-demand" - would that be more correct?

comments.content: The keyword here is "scale". Any time you see that, in regards to cloud computing, it's referencing rapid elasticity.
